result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy C Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.  Restitution is joint and several.  Bond on hand to be applied towards restitution.
Submit DNA sample.  AODA and comply.

with Huber work release.  Defendant may transfer conditional jail time to Sauk Cty or Dane Cty.  Defendant is eligible for electronic monitoring.

04/20/15 - AMENDED - Defendant's Jail start date is amended from 4/24/15 at 7:00 P.M. to 5/1/15 at 7:00 P.M.

4/30/15 AMENDED**  Jail start 5/02/16 at 7:00 pm.

AMENDED 6/17/16: Defendant may be released from jail at 8 a.m. on June 21, 2016 and return by 3 p.m., same day. This for purposes of attending his  grandfather's funeral.

AMENDED - 3/2/17 - Court grants stay of defendant's conditional jail time from Noon on Sunday, March 5th, 2017 until 7:00 P.M. on Thursday, March 9th, 2017

records.addlTxt: letter to defendant at Sauk County Jail returned.   "Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward."
to def re: no hearing for sentence modification per Judge Voigt

from defendant requesting a Furlough from 3/5/17 through 3/9/17 for father's funeral - by fax - Court approves stay of defendant's conditional jail time from Noon on Sunday March 5, 2017 until 7:00 P.M. on Thursday, March 9, 2017
Filed by ADA Troy Cross, objects to request for sentence modification filed by defendant.
filed by defendant, requesting sentence modification.

Defendant, Timothy C Schultz, appeared. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant made a statement to the Court on behalf of his motion.  State objected to the motion.  State would have no objection to a stay of one week to allow defendant to spend time with his terminally ill father.  Court agreed goodtime is not legally an option in this case.  Court will grant a stay of his sentence if defendant is able to verify the condition of his father.  He is to write a formal request for that time and court will review it.  1:54/2:09
Hearing on February 16, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant requests good time with letters on behalf of defendant also filed.

reviewed by Judge Voigt - no action - man

Defendant, Timothy C Schultz, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant filed a motion to amend the start date to 4-28-16, and requested a transfer to Sauk County.  State had no objection.  Court granted request.  JOC to be amended to show new report date.  JOC already has allowable transfer to Sauk County.

Current: 411 S. Center Avenue, Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 01-07-2016)

Defendant Timothy C Schultz in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jefferson county case 14CF235 was called  Judge Koschnick and DA Happ from Jefferson County present by video. Defendants atty for Jefferson Cty was present by video. Columia Cty cases called: 14CF93 & 14CF94.  ADA Cross read part of victim statement.  Atty Klopp gave statement.  Defendant is requesting to serve Jefferson Cty sentence first on electronic monitoring, and then serve Columbia County jail second.  Currently it is set for Columbia Cty first, with Jefferson Cty to follow.  ADA Cross would like this set so there is no time overlapping in the sentences.  Requested that Jefferson Cty change the start time to today or tomorrow, with Columbia Cty to follow.  Jefferson Cty does not oppose.  They will allow defendant to start his jail term today in Jefferson Cty.  Columbia Cty jail term will follow.  Court in Jefferson Cty will grant request and allow defendant to report tonight to Jefferson Cty for jail.  Columbia Cty court will grant request and allow defendant to serve his Columbia Cty Jail after the Jefferson Cty jail sentence.  Atty Klopp requested defendant be given a week to report to Jefferson Cty.  Jefferson Cty DA does not hold a position on the start date.  Court in Jefferson Cty will allow their judgment to reflect a report date of 5/7/15 by 7:00 pm.  Everything previously imposed remains.  Columbia Cty will set a report date of 5/2/16 at 7:00 pm.  Court recommended this be scheduled in April of 2016, to check on report date for defendant to make sure it is still current or address any potential changes on start date.
from L.F. addressed to ADA Cross stating she objects to defendant wanting to serve his time in Jefferson Cty.
Hearing on April 30, 2015 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Timothy C Schultz in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Cross addresses victim notification issues, have not been able to notify victims of the hearing, Atty Klopp would like to proceed, Court will hear argument, give DA's Office time to notify victims, and make ruling at another time, Atty Klopp requesting sentence modification, Attorney Cross objects to request, Court state's DA's Office to notify victim, will give Atty Cross a week to do so, Atty Klopp to check w/Jefferson County re: other case, Court will amend JOC for a new jail report date of 5/1/15 at 7:00 P.M.
for the 4/20/15 at 1:00 P.M. Motion Hearing
from defendant requesting permission to serve Jefferson Cty sentence first. - by fax
Restitution stipulation in the probation amount of $1750.00 and total of $1925.00 joint and several.

Defendant Timothy C Schultz in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 13CM555, 14CF438, 14CF93, & 14CF94.  In 14CF438  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived.  In all cases rights/elements.  In 14CF438 defendant plead no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 1,3,4, & 5 are dismissed.  In 14CF93 & 14CF94 defendant plead no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  In 13CM555 defendant plead no contest to Cts. 6 & 10.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 2,4, & 8 are dismissed but read in.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent to the probation on felony cases.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and comply.  Maintain full time employment or schooling or treatment.  Restitution $162.44 plus surcharge.  $443.00 costs both counts.  No jail credit due.  In 14CF438  Ct. 2 court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 5 years.  $518.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  4 days jail credit.   In 14CF93 and 14CF94 court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 5 years. Submit DNA sample.  $518.00 costs each case.  AODA and comply.  No jail credit will be determined in these two cases until it is needed.  In 14CF93 1 year conditional jail with Huber work release.   Restitution $1750.00 plus surcharge.  Any bond on hand to be applied towards restitution.  Jail start 4/24/15 at 7:00 pm.  Defendant may transfer conditional jail time to Sauk County or Dane County.  Defendant it eligible for electronic monitoring.
Amended to no violent contact with T.O.

Jury trial on February 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Bond modified to $250.00 cash.  All prior conditions remain.  Standard felony conditions.

Defendant Timothy C Schultz by video, in custody with attorney Roger L Klopp.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases heard:  14CF93 & 14CF94  State objected to bond modification.  Court grants motions both bond to be modified to $250.00 cash each, for a total of $500.00.  All other conditions remain the unchanged.

Cases heard: 14CF93 & 14CF94, Defendant Timothy C Schultz,, in custody, in court with attorney Roger L Klopp. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waivers of Preliminary Hearings filed. Court advised defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing in each case; defendant waived hearings. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Informations filed, readings waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty pleas, jury trials to be set. Bonds continued.  Atty Klopp states he does not represent defendant in 13CM555, which  is tracking with felony cases. Defendant to reapply to public defender in the misdemeanor case.
Bail/bond hearing on June 5, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
